notesStmt.note: Tidemarks at edges and occasionally across text. Usage stains. Slight foxing.
Appended are: a table (folio 129v) headed Luaḥ ha-gevulim, and a diagram (folio 130r) of the signs of zodiac.
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

Be᾿ur shesh kenafim באור שש כנפים

collation.p: Quires of mostly 10 leaves each, with decorated signatures at the beginning or at the end of the quires.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Italian semi-cursive of the 15th century. Shem Ṭov: inscribed in the colophon, folio 81r.

binding.p: Post 1600. Ivory vellum, damaged. Boxed. Spine: 'Abr. ben Chiya. Cheshbon Ham-Mahalachoth. Etc. Hebrew. Brit. Mus. Additional 27,106.'

history.provenance:
Acquisition:
Giuseppe Almanzi (b. 1801, d. 1860), bibliophile; his manuscript no. 212: his library including 322 medieval Hebrew manuscripts were purchased en bloc by the British Museum in October 1865 for £1,000 through Asher & Co., Berlin bookseller and dealer to the British Museum: inscribed, back flyleaf [i]v.
